Description: Name of the country or region.
The total amount of carbon dioxide, measured in metric tons, emitted by a country in a specific year.
The total number of people living in a specific country or region.
A measure of life satisfaction, where respondents rate their current lives on a ladder scale where 0 represents the worst possible life and 10 the best possible.
The average number of children a woman would have over her lifetime.
The average number of years a newborn child would live if current mortality patterns were to stay the same throughout its life.
An index published by Transparency International, which ranks countries by their perceived levels of public sector corruption, as determined by expert assessments and opinion surveys.
